byline.original: By KATHERINE REISNER and CATHERINE CROOKE

abstract: Op-Ed article by policy experts Katherine Reisner and Catherine Crooke presents case of Ahmed, Iraqi who was denied refugee status because he was not allowed legal counsel to guide him through strict requirement process; questions why Homeland Security Dept bars refugees from bringing counsel to their interviews.
lead_paragraph: The U.S. government forbids overseas asylum applicants from bringing legal counsel to hearings, making the process unfair and less efficient.
